p: Herein, the in situ reduction of potassium permanganate (KMnO 4) using MWCNTs as a supporting material has been carried out to produce MnO 2 heterostructure on multi-walled carbon nanotubes (MNH-CNT). The heterostructure was controlled via the ratio of an initial amount of KMnO 4 and MWCNTs. The as-prepared composite was examined to determine its physical characterization. Subsequently, the electrochemical properties and performances of ZIBs which used the MnO 2 on multi-walled carbon nanotubes (MN-CNT) as the host material cathode, are investigated and discussed.
